The overall goal of this project is to support the governments of KZ, KG and TJ to apply the investment logic and investment approach and receive better return on investments in AIDS, linking to CAR PEPFAR strategy objectives #2 and #3.
This effort will help countries evaluate the state of the disease, shift programming towards the most impactful interventions, address inefficiencies in programs and understand total cost and impact. This activity is cost efficient by design, as it assists governments to more effectively program HIV funds and transitions skills and knowledge to national experts who, with the more specific budgeting assistance of the HFG activity, will operationalize shifts in HIV spending. Results of the investment framework activity will guide future Country Coordinating Mechanism (CCM) applications to the Global Fund (GF) and facilitate a sustainable transition and country ownership of current USG pilot activities improving the enabling environment and quality of HIV-related service delivery.
The project will be led by the National AIDS Centres and/or country Ministries of Health (MOHs), together with other key institutions such as the National Institute for Public Health Development in KZ and National Institute for Strategic Studies in KG with appropriate technical support provided from UNAIDS RST in Moscow, country offices and other appropriate external consults as needed. The activity will develop a monitoring and evaluation plan to track progress and results in the three priority countries. $600,000 has been transferred to this activity, which is expected to begin in April, 2014.
